CatDescriptText: Miss Veronique Dever, student, Perrysville was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 19, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "what action, if any, should be taken and by whom, when Negro members of integrated teams refuse to play before segregated crowds?"  Answer reads: "In sports, there never should be such a thing as segregation.  Athletes go all over the world, in the Olympics, and never come in contact with segregation.  Why should we have it here?"
TitMainTitle: Two frames; Three women standing in a circle, including Veronique Dever, wearing circular floral suit, standing in front of group of people; Portrait of Veronique Dever wearing circular floral suit, standing in front of pedestrians and building
